intro: Craterostigma goetzei, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and has a compact growth habit. It is often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant resilience and evolution.
